attributes.action: Bring back levels for assessment and stop labelling our children as failures.
attributes.background: Children who don't meet the expected standard for their year group are being assessed as emerging and not 'Year _ ready'. Essentially we are telling them they have failed! Children need encouragement not labelling in this way. Levels mean that progress can easily be seen year on year.
attributes.additional_details: A whole generation of our children risk being labelled failures by the system that replaced levels. Previously a child and their parents would easily see progress during a school year by looking at their levels. Currently they are labelled as 'emerging', 'expected' or 'exceeding' and a child who is emerging is then described as not being ready for the next year group that they move in to. If our children are to achieve their true potential, we need to stop labelling them as failures!

attributes.action: Government to condemn the USA police forces for killing innocent Black citizens
attributes.background: Statistics show that on average around 30 African American citizens in America are killed by law enforcement officers each month.  This is unacceptable in a civilized society.  The UK is America's closest alley and so should be able to speak up and ask that America takes measures to stop this issue.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_in_the_United_States

attributes.action: Ban Wearing Burka's While Driving
attributes.background: I and many others will agree that woman wearing a burka should not be allowed to drive a vehicle this is highly dangerous as you do not have full vision of the road and things surrounding you.
attributes.additional_details: I understand this item of clothing worn is a sign of religion. This does not take away the fact of how dangerous wearing this is whilst driving. This has been recently banned in France and I think the UK should take action against this to prevent very serious accidents or even death happening.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to park a motor vehicle on a public footpath.
attributes.background: Vehicles obstructing the public footpath, are breaking the law, to enable a vehicle to park in such a way, the vehicle has driven to its position, driving on the footpath is illegal. Pedestrians on many occasions have to walk into traffic to pass these vehicles obstructing the footpath.
attributes.additional_details: Section 34(1) of the Road Traffic Act 1988 (RTA 1988) provides that anyone driving a mechanically propelled vehicle, for example a motor car, on a road that is a footpath, bridleway or restricted byway is guilty of an offence unless it can be shown that there is a private right in place for people to use the accessway to gain vehicular access to their property. The burden of proving that there is such a vehicular right of way in place rests with the defendant.

attributes.action: Disability football should get more recognition
attributes.background: I Strongly Believe That Disability Football Should be Recognized more as a normal thing in society and that our government should support it more by supplying more funding and more publicity,
attributes.additional_details: Football can play a key role in any persons development let alone a disabled persons development, It can help them get Independence, socialize more and develop fine motor skills. Most football clubs run Disability football and it should get recognize more just like main stream football.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: All NHS employers to pay staff at least the living wage.
attributes.background: Some of the lowest paid NHS staff are working below the living wage. Please sign and support this petition

attributes.action: Debate within 100 days the Government's costed plan for the UK to leave the EU
attributes.background: Good governance requires such a momentous change of national direction to be underpinned by a properly formulated plan with specific objectives, milestones for the change process and timescales for final delivery, detailed costings and an associated risk management plan.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the United Kingdom must be informed of the plan and its detail debated in Parliament within 100 days.

attributes.action: Teach anti-racist/bullying and self esteem building classes in schools
attributes.background: In this day and age we have come across more prejudice, xenophobia, racism and bullying.  This has escalated due to recent events.  In order for the future generation of children the most important thing a child should learn is respect for self and others.
attributes.additional_details: We must teach that bullying is wrong, tolerance for others is important for the process of peace. The current situation as we have discovered from recent events from voting out, has left our country in a state of racism, xenophobia and bullying.  We must act quickly to instigate peace and so that the new generation of Brits are tolerance, happier and peaceful people.  We have a country of British people of all races, religions, sexes and we must learn to live in peace and respectful of each other.  Bullying has been a major factor in all schools and the only way to diminish it is to build respect for self and others through classes and build their self esteem. This will have a positive impact for the future generation of British people no matter what race they are from.

attributes.action: Keep the United Kingdom inside the European Economic Area (EEA) and rejoin EFTA.
attributes.background:
-A supermajority of young people voted to remain inside the European Union
-We now know the consequences truly of voting to leave and Article 50 hasn't yet been triggered.
-Hundreds of thousands if not millions of Leave voters regret their decision
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned pledge our support for the United Kingdom remaining a part of the EEA, which includes the EU alongside Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. We pledge our support for rejoining the European Free Trade Agreement, which we established in 1960 and led until 1973. EEA member countries outside the EU participate in its single market but can also negotiate trade agreements freely and independently. We the British people would also continue to have de facto European Union citizenship.

attributes.action: Create a memorial or name a room within the Palace of Westminster after Jo Cox
attributes.background: Jo Cox MP was a Member of Parliament who dedicated the past year to her community and often fought for more things for Young people. In the memory of her life I propose that the Palace of Westminster name an area, room or dedicate a memorial to her life in her memory.

attributes.action: Fully fund University Education for priority careers e.g. Health,Sciences Eng...
attributes.background: We desperately need Doctors, Scientists, Engineers, yet every year we fail to train in sufficient numbers whilst pumping out graduates in law, media, politics, travel and more exotic topics which rarely lead to careers where our society needs them most.
attributes.additional_details:
We must encourage more students entering higher education to consider where society needs them most by offering to fully fund their academic fees on the basis that they first qualify and then agree to work in their chosen field here in the UK for a minimum of 10 years after qualifying or the fee's - based on a sliding scale will be recoverable.
These publicly funded places should be offered entirely to satisfy the needs of our society and no other consideration should be evaluated or allowed.

attributes.action: Don't ban menthol cigarettes
attributes.background:
Plain packaging is coming into force and there is a proposal to ban menthol cigarettes. 


Menthol cigarettes makes up a large percentage of smokers and has existed for almost a hundred years.


Ban other flavours but make an exception for menthols like the US.
attributes.additional_details:
I thought all cigarettes were the same, so why treat some cigarettes different to others?


- Ban flavours, keep the menthol


- Halt any new anti-tobbaco law for at least 10 years 


- Don't allow cigarette prices to reach £15 by 2020

attributes.action: Stop charging extortionate Child Visa fees and NHS Surcharges
attributes.background: Dependent children of Non-EU immigrants are charged same visa fees and NHS levy as adults. It is appalling that child visa fee in a temporary visa category is as much as £1790+ £200 NHS levy/year. They are not entitled to any kind of state benefits in the UK and shouldn’t be charged hefty visa fees
attributes.additional_details: If a Non-EU family of 4, 2 adults and 2 toddlers, needs to extend their stay in UK for 2 years, they would pay £7160 Visa + Biometric fees and £1600 NHS levy. Visa fee is irrespective of how short is their stay, means if an immigrant’s spouse and a child granted 6 months visa they would still pay £3580 in visa fees only. Fair fees are part of business ethics and Governments are also expected to conduct their business ethically. Be ethical and considerate and abolish child visa fees and NHS Levy

attributes.action: hold a referendum on  giving 0.7% of GDP in foreign aid.
attributes.background: Call on the British government to hold a referendum on giving 0.7% of GDP to foreign aid

attributes.action: Require universities to provide night-time safety to stop sexual harassment
attributes.background: Improve safety around the University at night for women and men when traveling and walking around the site.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost £4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: All NHS ambulance trusts to use a life saving database which is free to use
attributes.background: The AUXILIUM SYSTEM was invented and funded after two local girls were killed on the way to and from school. The database was developed over several years from discussion with many Doctors Paramedics, Ambulance Hub Personnel etc. The database will be free for the NHS to use now and forever.
attributes.additional_details: If a person wearing an AUXILIUM number is found unconscious the number can be read to an ambulance call centre, then person’s information is relayed to paramedics regarding the patient before the paramedics arrive on the scene. .The AUXILIUM number costs only £1 per year per person, and you can change as many times as you wish .AUXILIUM has offered around 1,000,000 lifesaving numbers to charities and is now able to offer all schools in the UK a free number for all their pupils around 8 million.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Government to Stop using private enterprise caterer and return military cooks
attributes.background: At present the services use private enterprise caterer such as Sodexo Catering Services. and the standard of food provided is not to a suitable standards.  and as the cost is increasing this situation should be rectified
attributes.additional_details: As members of the services are on a compulsory pay to dine scheme and it would appear their complaints are ignored. the government must take action.  The services have to have catering staff for service in areas of hostility these should also be in charge af army cook houses

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Cross party review of Hinkley Point C costs, design risks and EDF's commitment.
attributes.background:
Hinkley Point C go-ahead is imminent.
Review needed of:
- construction costs,
- design risks (design known to be a problem / unproven),
- EDF's commitment to UK project given their own nuclear fleet needs refurbishment,
- agreed strike-price and top up by customers now power prices have fallen
attributes.additional_details:
http://stophinkley.org/StopPress.htm
https://secure.greenpeace.org.uk/page/s/osborne-dont-waste-billions-nuclear?source=em&subsource=20160307egem01&utm_source=gpeace&utm_medium=em&utm_campaign=20160307egem01

attributes.action: There needs to be a cull of seagulls in Britain
attributes.background: The seagull menace in Dundee and Angus has become to much for the residents to bear and we request a cull. We also believe this to be a nationwide problem and believe most coastal towns at least would support this cull.
attributes.additional_details: We are sick of the noise pollution, attacks, destruction, etc etc and call on this Government to act

attributes.action: Ensure there are dedicated disability wards for over 18s in hospitals
attributes.background: Our beautiful disabled daughter/Sister age 26 died of Pneumonia and we think the care of the ward could of been a lot better if there was a dedicated ward with 1 to 1 care and trained disability nurses!

attributes.action: Stay in the EU, enact Proportional Representation, and call a General Election
attributes.background:
Following the referendum on the UK’s membership of the EU, we the undersigned call upon the British government to:

1. Reject the outcome of the referendum and formally state that the UK wishes to remain in the EU.

2. Enact Proportional Representation.

3. Call a General Election.

attributes.action: Honour our Queen by minting coins in real silver
attributes.background: Being a metal detectorist my friends and I find so many beautiful ancient coins that have stood up to being buried for centuries.  The coins we have now would have all rotted away of a similar period, let's honour our Queen by minting a few nice silver coins.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at the Spinks coin book and you can see many examples of the beautiful coins our Monarchy once had minted in their name. For me to give examples I would need to be able to upload examples of Silver Hammered coins or the Silver Milled ones of more recent times.

attributes.action: Scrap charges at hospital car parks.
attributes.background: It is unfair and at times a dangerous practice to charge.  It is an essential service and causes problems for visiting routine and emergency appointments.  It causes unnecessary hardship.

attributes.action: Give all British expats and EU citizens living long-term in UK vote on EU.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Act of 2015 disqualified many people who vote in local or general elections from voting on EU membership. We ask for a reform of the Act, to give franchise on EU membership to all British expats, and to EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years.
attributes.additional_details:
Commonwealth citizens residing in the UK could vote on EU membership on 23rd June 2016, whilst expats living abroad for more than fifteen years, and EU citizens living in Britain, could not. This disfavours individuals who have fully invested in the opportunities granted by Britain’s long-term membership of the EU. We believe the Act goes against EU rights of free movement and the constitutional, common law of Britain.
We ask for another Act to be passed to allow a new Referendum in which all expats, and EU citizens residing and paying taxes in the UK for at least five years, may vote. If we are to leave or remain in the EU, it must be a lawful decision, reflecting the wishes of our entire society.

attributes.action: Call a referendum so London can decide to be part of the UK or remain in the EU.
attributes.background:
London, as defined by all postal codes with a LONDON prefix, voted by overwhelming majority in the recent European referendum to remain part of the EU.  

We, the undersigned, believe that London should be allowed to decide its own future as separate from the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
London and its population has stronger ties to Europe than it does to England.  e.g. our dependence on financial services.

London voted by a similar margin in favour of Remain as Scotland.  By the same right that Scotland has to now decide its future, so does London. 

Our population is significantly more European and culturally diverse than the rest of the UK.

London gives more to the UK in tax revenue than the UK gives to London.  We would be stronger if financially independent.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey joining the EU until they cease their illegal occupation of Cyprus
attributes.background: In July 1974, Turkish forces twice invaded and captured the island of Cyprus and now illegally occupy 40% of it. Cyprus is a member of the EU and Turkey wish to join. Countries that occupy member states illegally cannot join the EU but Turkey will be allowed to unless it is vetoed.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_invasion_of_Cyprus

attributes.action: Means test Maternity Pay reflecting women on leave who are 'the breadwinner'
attributes.background:
The current basic ruling on maternity pay is as follows :

Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get:
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks
- £139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
Information from:
https://www.gov.uk/maternity-pay-leave/pay

attributes.action: Retain passport/take fingerprints at point of entry to aid later identification.
attributes.background: Many foreigners making Visa entry to the UK to study, or for holidays, later break their Visa conditions, overstay and take work illegally.  If their Passports were retained, and they were given an authorised copy, to use whilst here, they could be easily identified via fingerprints and deported.

attributes.action: Make the UK main summer test cricket series, a free to air television event.
attributes.background: This petition is for a ruling, that the main test cricket series of the summer in England or Wales be shown on free to air television. As are The FA Cup, The Six Nations and The Grand National; with a protected, permanent free to air broadcasting status.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition strongly believes that in order to develop the next generation of cricket stars, youngsters need to be able to easily and readily see cricketing heroes, performing at the highest cricket level. It is one of our national sports and the entire nation should be able to watch the main summer test match series.

This is one test series a year on free to air television. So this petition feels that this is a fair demand.

attributes.action: Ban the transportation and slaughter of pregnant sows
attributes.background: Tired, terrified and heavily pregnant sows are being transported to abattoirs and  frequently give birth during this harrowing journey.
attributes.additional_details: For many piglets their initial experience of this world consists of lying helplessly on the floor of a vehicle which is carting their mother off to slaughter or falling through slats onto the road below.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to set up camp on public or private land without permission
attributes.background: In Newport gypsies set up camp with 14 caravans and an array of luxury cars including two Mercedes, a BMW X6, and a Volkswagen, blocked hundreds of NHS staff from parking outside the hospital. Hospital spokesman Ms Hayman said legal advice was sought over how to eject them.
attributes.additional_details:
Can gypsies and travellers occupy any seemingly vacant land?
No, as mentioned above, they cannot simply occupy land because it is vacant, if it has not been designated for this purpose.
Gypsies or travellers should contact the local authority in the area in which they wish to camp to find out whether there is any space for them on a permanent, or temporary site.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on investment silver coins and bars.
attributes.background:
Silver coins and bars are an accessible long term investment for many people. The application of VAT on silver is unfair. 

There is no VAT on investment gold coins and bars which favours wealthier investors. Some EU states do not charge VAT on silver bullion which gives them an unfair advantage.
attributes.additional_details:
Silver has been bought as a store of value for centuries. Most investments do not attract VAT for example stocks, shares, bonds, savings accounts, property and gold bullion.

1 Kilogram silver bars and 1oz silver Britannia coins are the most commonly purchased silver investments in the UK.

attributes.action: Remove hereditary peers from the House of Lords
attributes.background: The time has come to remove an outdated oddity from Parliament. There is no place for peers who gain their positions simply by being born into them. This is the logical step needed to finish the reforms of 1999.

attributes.action: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens.
attributes.background: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens. This will allow more students to have the opportunity to get a degree and be able to apply for the best jobs.

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: Please start funding pet cemeteries like other country's.
attributes.background: I think we can all agree that our pets are more than just pets, they become best friends and family members. it is only because of my dog that I can leave my house due to my mental health. He is my bet friend and I think others will agree we need a place to rest them just like we do with people.
attributes.additional_details: As a lot of us see them as more than pets, we should have places where we can bury them and let them rest in piece. They are loved ones and should be treated as such. They don't ask for a lot in life, all they ask for is love and care and don't we all just want love? If you look after your animal, they will look after you. Please consider this as I can assure you, many, many people will really appreciate being able to use these places. Thank you.

attributes.action: Shouting Racist when it is not to be charged for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.background: People who shout RACIST and point the finger when it is not are causing major hate and divisions in the UK and should be imprisoned for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.additional_details:
Everyday online and in the media we hear of RACISM when it is not. We see Labour Councillors and MPs crying Racist when people are just trying to express how they feel.

This shouting of Racism takes the light off real Racist and Racism and the people of the UK are now starting to forget real racist attacks as they are ''FED UP'' with being branded a racist when they are not.

attributes.action: Legalise civil partnerships for heterosexual couples
attributes.background: Everyone, whether heterosexual, homosexual, or bisexual, should have the option of entering into either a marriage, or a civil partnership.

attributes.action: Set up Brexit commission to advise on implications before Article 50 invoked
attributes.background: In the referendum campaign voters asked for the facts but with no historic precedent this left politicians free to say anything to secure votes.  The implications are now much clearer with some known facts to draw on. An independent commission will provide impartial advice before invoking Article 50

attributes.action: Call a General Election in 2017.  Brexit needs a plan with an electoral mandate.
attributes.background:
A referendum vote to leave and "take our freedom back" is not a plan - its a protest. We need a plan on how we leave and what we do next.
This plan should have an electoral mandate from us all - Brexiteers and Remainers alike. 
That is the only way to can build a new unity and a strong future.
attributes.additional_details:
We need three things ASAP:
1. The parties (old guard, and maybe new?) should propose their Brexit plan. 
2. A General Election should be called soon - ideally Spring 2017.
3. The plan people want most will receive a proper mandate.
We can make something good happen. We will have to look beyond our party allegiances to do so. Please get stuck in. Share, like, petition, .... or come up with something better than this.

attributes.action: Allow a second referendum on the subject of our membership of the European Union
attributes.background: We believe that the "In" or "Out" choice was too simplistic for a decision of such importance and that clear and unbiased information was not available. We believe that we should have been asked additionally, or instead, "Would you chose to remain within a substantially reformed European Union"?

attributes.action: Require 75% turnout 60% majority for & 16+ voting in future   referendums
attributes.background: Less than 40% of UK Adults voted to for Brexit- a change that can't be reversed.  We must introduce a "triple lock" on future referendums about constitutional and irreversible changes.  The turn out must exceed 75%,  the majority in favour of change must exceed 60% and all those aged 16+ can vote

attributes.action: Establish London as an independent state so it can remain in the EU
attributes.background: Greater London voted overwhelmingly to remain. A disproportionate amount of our taxes goes to finance other regions in the UK & our economic wellbeing is severely threatened by a decision imposed upon us by others. We wish to cede from the UK & become an independent state within the EU.

attributes.action: Get Washington out of Sunderland and back into County Durham council
attributes.background: Washington is in decline and Sunderland council still do nothing, why should the rest of the city be clean and Washington left out to waste away

attributes.action: Introduce a social awareness lesson within the curriculum.
attributes.background: Bullying and discrimination within schools needs to be stopped. Let's introduce a social awareness lesson to allow youngsters the freedom of speech and allow them to talk about problems open and freely. Educate our youngsters the benefits of talking about problems and acceptance of other people.
attributes.additional_details: By educating youngsters about everyone is different and copes with things in different ways this will allow them to understand others behaviours and attitudes in situations. Mental health is vital within youngsters and allowing them to have a social skills lesson where they can talk about problems and understand that everyone battles life in different ways, and talk about their feelings and worries. Teaching our kids while still young will give them coping mechanisms to deal with different situations and teach them that bullying and discrimination is unacceptable and that not all illnesses/disabilities are visible.
